game.ai.playertracker

Class PlayerTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.ai.playertracker.PlayerTracker

  • public class PlayerTracker
extends java.lang.Object
    stores the Resources of a Player and counts the as the game goes on. if it is not clear how much Resources the player loses/gains, then this class will create as many Resource object as there are possibilities
    Author:
    Wanja Sajko

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayerTracker(Player player, Game game)
      Constructor which sets the players resources to 0 for each ResourceType

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerTracker

        public PlayerTracker(Player player,
                     Game game)
        Constructor which sets the players resources to 0 for each ResourceType
        Parameters:
        player - the specific player
        game - the game on which all players are playing

    • Method Detail

      • updateResources

        public void updateResources(int diceValue)
        adds resources to the player. if the player has a Settlement at a Hex with the number diceValue, add one to the corresponding resource. if the player has a City at a Hex with the number diceValue, add two to the corresponding resource.
        Parameters:
        diceValue - the value of the dice

      • decreaseResources

        public void decreaseResources(Resources subResources)
        uses the subtract method in Resources to decrease the resources of the tracked Player
        Parameters:
        subResources - the Resources that are subtracted
        See Also:
        Resources

      • decreaseResources

        public void decreaseResources(int amount)
        uses the subtractResources method in Resources to decrease the resources of the tracked Player if the exact resourceType is unknown, the playerTracker creates new Resource objects with all possibilities
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of resources the player loses

      • increaseResources

        public void increaseResources(int amount)
        uses the addResources method in Resources to increase the resources of the tracked Player if the exact resourceType is unknown, the playerTracker creates new Resource objects with all possibilities
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of resources the player gains

      • setAllNewResources

        public void setAllNewResources(int amount)
        create an ArrayList with all possible variations to split amount resources on the 5 resourceTypes
        Parameters:
        amount - amount of resources

      • updateResources

        public void updateResources(Resources addResources)
        uses the add method in Resources to increase the resources of the tracked player
        Parameters:
        addResources - the added resources
        See Also:
        Resources

      • resetResources

        public void resetResources()
        reset all Resources of the tracked player

      • canAffordSettlementProbability

        public float canAffordSettlementProbability()
        checks if there is a possibility, that the ai can afford a Settlement.
        Returns:
        probability, the probability that the player can afford a Settlement

      • tryExchange

        public boolean tryExchange(int[] playerResources)
        Tries to exchange Resources with the bank, so it can afford the neededResources
        Parameters:
        playerResources - the current Resources the player has
        Returns:
        true, if it can trade. false, otherwise

      • getResourceAmount

        public float getResourceAmount(ResourceType reType)
        gets the probability, that the player has the Resource with the ResourceType reType
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        float between 0 and 1

      • decreaseResourcesMonopoly

        public void decreaseResourcesMonopoly(ResourceType resourceType)
        sets the flags for the monopolyCard, so the next ServerMessage can be handled
        Parameters:
        resourceType - ResourceType

      • increaseResourcesMonopoly

        public void increaseResourcesMonopoly(ResourceType resourceType)
        sets the flags for the monopolyCard, so the next ServerMessage can be handled
        Parameters:
        resourceType - ResourceType

      • decreaseMonopoly

        public void decreaseMonopoly(int amount)
        reduces the amount of the resource with the resourcetype stored in monopoly to 0. if one of the possible Resource objects dosn't have the same amount as given, it will be removed sets the flag loseResources to false, so other Server messages will be correct interpreted
        Parameters:
        amount - Integer

      • increaseMonopoly

        public void increaseMonopoly(int amount)
        increases the amount of the resource with the resourcetype stored in monopoly by amount. sets the flag winResources to false, so other Server messages will be correct interpreted
        Parameters:
        amount - Integer

      • setCost

        public void setCost(int b)
        sets the amount the player has spend
        Parameters:
        b - the cost

      • setCostResources

        public void setCostResources(Resources costResources)
        sets the Resources the player has spend
        Parameters:
        costResources - the resources

      • updateResourcesTrade

        public void updateResourcesTrade()
        updates the Resources objects of the player after a sea-Trade. this Method will be called, when the playerTracker doesn't know which Resources the player has traded

      • updateResourcesTrade

        public void updateResourcesTrade(Resources resourcesToAdd)
        updates the Resources objects of the player after a sea-Trade. this Method will be called, when the playerTracker does know which Resources the player has traded
        Parameters:
        resourcesToAdd - the resources the player gets of his trade
